title: Calculating Ascender and Descender
content:
Like I said before, I'm working on a sans serif face in a vectorial program. Now I have to transport the glyphs to a font program.   
   
I saw a formula at point central to calculate the ascender and descender values based on a 1000 em square, but after checking ascenders and descenders of font files I got confused about where to start to count the ascender and descender lines. Is the top limit of a capital acute (

 [‹ More sophisticated Nimrod substitute](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121122925/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6154 "Go to previous forum topic") [Starting a new type ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121122925/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6115 "Go to next forum topic")
author: fermello78

comments.content:
There are no firm rules, but the general practice seems to be to:   
- Put the top limit somewhat above the ascenders or caps (whichever is higher) so that the cap accents float mostly above it.   
- Put the bottom limit just a hair below the descenders.   
   
hhp
